author: Greg P.
title: UK officials dish on why Donald Trump was holding Theresa Mayâ€™s hand, and it sounds like BS
text:
UK officials dish on why Donald Trump was holding Theresa Mayâ€™s hand, and it sounds like BS Posted at 5:59   Greg P.   
Did you happen to catch President Trump hold UK Prime Minister Theresa Mayâ€™s hand when the exited the Oval Office last week? ICYMI: 
Well, itâ€™s being reported in the British press that President Trump asked to hold Mayâ€™s hand because heâ€™s allegedly afraid of walking down stairs or ramps. From The Sunday Times: Times of London claims Trump has a phobia of "slopes and stairs" so he grabbed May's hand https://t.co/AL44beCd9V 
â€” Maggie Haberman (@maggieNYT) January 29, 2017 Theresa May's staff is claiming the only reason she held Trump's hand is because he's afraid of stairs. Unreal. ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ https://t.co/8oXOqWqM0d pic.twitter.com/2Al2dnsTq3 
â€” Josh Jordan (@NumbersMuncher) January 29, 2017 
The Telegraph reported on it as well: 
B ut Government sources in Washington DC were suggesting that the hand-holding was not as a result of a deep and lasting friendship after all. 
The insider said that Mr Trump is known to have an aversion to slopes or stairs, and said this could have been the reason for the presidentâ€™s decision to grasp the Prime Ministerâ€™s hand. 
Can we go ahead an call BS on this now as weâ€™ve seen plenty of pictures of President Trump walking down stairs? Here's Trump walking down steps without assistance. 
Shameless lies from the UK government re Trump/May hand holding. pic.twitter.com/wmbgLb5Z6c 
â€” Steve Peers (@StevePeers) January 29, 2017 
Exit question: Why are anonymous officials in the UK government trying to embarrass President Trump? "May was holding Trump's hand because he's afraid of stairs" is one of the more imaginative bits of No. 10 briefing I've heard in a while. 
â€” Sam Freedman (@Samfr) January 28, 2017
